alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 9:51AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Salcha River * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas is expected along the Salcha River. High water is likely to impact some access to some low lying cabins along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 AM AKDT, Runoff from snowmelt continues to move down the Salcha River. This surge of water is expected to reach the Richardson Highway bridge area over the next two days. The higher elevation snowpack has diminished considerably over the past few days and water levels will gradually fall later this week. - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: - Residents or others along the Salcha River should be prepared for high water and move items near the riverbank to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
